pullRequest.title: Added the ability to mark ignored players inside clan chat
pullRequest.bodyText: I will reference #10515 although it does not fix the issue but only fixes the second idea of clan chats marking ignores.

nodes.bodyText: Is there a better way to detect this? Some people have an rsn matching World \\d+
Ideally the config names should be fairly short since it is what shows in the panel, and then have a longer description. maybe Mark ignored players or something.
You can pull the ignore container out of this loop

beforeCommit.message: Some optimization work and remove scripts

afterCommit.message:
clanchat: ability to mark ignored players

Revert change and only add ClahnChatChannelRebuidl script files

Revert the changes for scripts

Add back script changes, fix a spelling mistake and fix regex issue

Invoke colorIngorePlayers later

Co-Authored-By: Adam <adam@sigterm.info>

Make clanChatList a variable

Co-Authored-By: Adam <adam@sigterm.info>

Use clanChatList in for

Co-Authored-By: Adam <adam@sigterm.info>

Fix possible World player names

Some optimization work and remove scripts

Revert "Some optimization work and remove scripts"

This reverts commit 29cc2d20f3a313ec3b7df7cf24186192883faf0b.

nodes.bodyText: This needs to run on the client thread. Also you could check the config key being changed.
maybe "Recolors players on your ignore list" or something. "Allows you to pick out" could mean anything.
this comment is just explaining why your previous implementation is a bad idea, but has nothing to do with this. i would remove it.
